001package gust.backend.model;
002
003import com.google.common.base.Function;
004import com.google.common.util.concurrent.AsyncFunction;
005import com.google.common.util.concurrent.Futures;
006import com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture;
007import com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListeningScheduledExecutorService;
008import com.google.protobuf.Message;
009import gust.backend.runtime.ReactiveFuture;
010import tools.elide.core.DatapointType;
011
012import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
013import javax.annotation.Nullable;
014import java.util.Objects;
015import java.util.Optional;
016
017import static java.lang.String.format;
018import static gust.backend.model.ModelMetadata.*;
019
020
021/**
022 * Specifies an adapter for data models. "Adapters" are responsible for handling data storage and recall, and generic
023 * model serialization and deserialization activities. Adapters are composed of a handful of components, which together
024 * define the functionality that composes the adapter writ-large.
025 *
026 * <p>Major components of functionality are described below:
027 * <ul>
028 *   <li><b>Codec:</b> The {@link ModelCodec} is responsible for serialization and deserialization. In some cases,
029 *   codecs can be mixed with other objects to customize how data is stored. For example, the Redis cache layer supports
030 *   using ProtoJSON, Protobuf binary, or JVM serialization, optionally with compression. On the other hand, the
031 *   Firestore adapter specifies its own codecs which serialize into Firestore models.</li>
032 *   <li><b>Driver:</b> The {@link PersistenceDriver} is responsible for persisting serialized/collapsed models into
033 *   underlying storage, deleting data recalling data via key fetches, and querying indexes to produce result-sets.</li>
034 * </ul></p>
035 *
036 * @see PersistenceDriver Interface which defines basic driver functionality.
037 * @see CacheDriver Cache-specific persistence driver support, included in this object.
038 * @see DatabaseAdapter Extends this interface with richer data engine features.
039 * @param <Key> Key type, instances of which uniquely address instances of {@code Model}.
040 * @param <Model> Model type which this adapter is responsible for adapting.
041 * @param <Intermediate> Intermediate record format used by the implementation when de-serializing model instances.
042 */
043@SuppressWarnings("UnstableApiUsage")
044public interface ModelAdapter<Key extends Message, Model extends Message, Intermediate>
045  extends PersistenceDriver<Key, Model, Intermediate> {
046  // -- Interface: Drivers -- //
047  /**
048   * Return the cache driver in use for this particular model adapter. If a cache driver is present, and active/enabled
049   * according to database driver settings, it will be used on read-paths (such as fetching objects by ID).
050   *
051   * @return Cache driver currently in use by this model adapter.
052   */
053  @Nonnull Optional<CacheDriver<Key, Model>> cache();
054
055  /**
056   * Return the lower-level {@link PersistenceDriver} powering this adapter. The driver is responsible for communicating
057   * with the actual backing storage service, either via local stubs/emulators or a production API.
058   *
059   * @return Persistence driver instance currently in use by this model adapter.
060   */
061  @Nonnull PersistenceDriver<Key, Model, Intermediate> engine();
062
063  // -- Interface: Execution -- //
064  /** {@inheritDoc} */
065  @Override
066  default @Nonnull ListeningScheduledExecutorService executorService() {
067    return engine().executorService();
068  }
069
070  // -- Interface: Key Generation -- //
071  /** {@inheritDoc} */
072  @Override
073  default @Nonnull Key generateKey(@Nonnull Message instance) {
074    return engine().generateKey(instance);
075  }
076
077  // -- Interface: Fetch -- //
078  /** {@inheritDoc} */
079  @Override
080  default @Nonnull ReactiveFuture<Optional<Model>> retrieve(@Nonnull Key key, @Nonnull FetchOptions options) {
081    enforceRole(key, DatapointType.OBJECT_KEY);
082    final ListeningScheduledExecutorService exec = options.executorService().orElseGet(this::executorService);
083    if (Internals.logging.isTraceEnabled())
084      Internals.logging.trace(format("Retrieving record '%s' from storage (executor: '%s')...", id(key), exec));
085
086    final Optional<CacheDriver<Key, Model>> cache = this.cache();
087    if (options.enableCache() && cache.isPresent()) {
088      if (Internals.logging.isDebugEnabled())
089        Internals.logging.debug(
090          format("Caching enabled with object of type '%s'.", cache.get().getClass().getSimpleName()));
091
092      // cache result future
093      final ReactiveFuture<Optional<Model>> cacheFetchFuture = Objects.requireNonNull(
094        cache.get().fetchCached(key, options, exec), "Cache cannot return `null` for `retrieve`.");
095
096      // wrap in a future, with a non-propagating cancelling timeout, which handles any nulls from the cache.
097      final ListenableFuture<Optional<Model>> cacheFuture = (Futures.nonCancellationPropagating(
098        Futures.transform(cacheFetchFuture, new Function<>() {
099          @Override
100          public @Nonnull Optional<Model> apply(@Nullable Optional<Model> cacheResult) {
101            if (Internals.logging.isDebugEnabled()) {
102              //noinspection OptionalAssignedToNull
103              Internals.logging.debug(
104                format("Received response from cache (value present: '%s').",
105                  cacheResult == null ? "null" : cacheResult.isPresent()));
106            }
107            if (cacheResult != null && cacheResult.isPresent()) {
108              return cacheResult;
109            }
110            return Optional.empty();  // not found
111          }
112        }, exec)));
113
114      // wrap the cache future in a timeout function, which enforces the configured (or default) cache timeout
115      final ListenableFuture<Optional<Model>> limitedCacheFuture = Futures.withTimeout(
116        cacheFuture,
117        options.cacheTimeout().orElse(PersistenceDriver.DEFAULT_CACHE_TIMEOUT),
118        options.cacheTimeoutUnit(),
119        exec);
120
121      // finally, respond to a cache miss by deferring to the driver directly. this must be separate from `cacheFuture`
122      // to allow separate cancellation of the cache future and the future which backstops it.
123      return ReactiveFuture.wrap(Futures.transformAsync(limitedCacheFuture, new AsyncFunction<>() {
124        @Override
125        public @Nonnull ListenableFuture<Optional<Model>> apply(@Nullable Optional<Model> cacheResult) {
126          if (Internals.logging.isTraceEnabled()) {
127            //noinspection OptionalAssignedToNull
128            Internals.logging.debug(
129              format("Returning response from cache (value present: '%s')",
130                cacheResult == null ? "null" : cacheResult.isPresent()));
131          }
132
133          if (cacheResult != null && cacheResult.isPresent()) {
134            return Futures.immediateFuture(cacheResult);
135          } else {
136            var record = engine().retrieve(key, options);
137            record.addListener(() -> {
138              if (Internals.logging.isDebugEnabled()) {
139                Internals.logging.debug("Response was NOT cached. Storing in cache...");
140              }
141
142              Internals.swallowExceptions(() -> {
143                Optional<Model> fetchResult = record.get();
144                if (fetchResult.isPresent()) {
145                  cache.get().injectRecord(
146                    key,
147                    fetchResult.get(),
148                    options.executorService().orElseGet(ModelAdapter.this::executorService));
149                }
150              });
151            }, options.executorService().orElseGet(ModelAdapter.this::executorService));
152            return record;
153          }
154        }
155      }, exec), exec);
156    } else {
157      if (Internals.logging.isDebugEnabled()) {
158        Internals.logging.debug("Caching is disabled. Deferring to driver.");
159      }
160      return engine().retrieve(key, options);
161    }
162  }
163
164  // -- Interface: Persist -- //
165  /** {@inheritDoc} */
166  @Override
167  default @Nonnull ReactiveFuture<Model> persist(@Nullable Key key,
168                                                 @Nonnull Model model,
169                                                 @Nonnull WriteOptions options) {
170    return engine().persist(key, model, options);
171  }
172}
